description: Comprehensive vocabulary dictionary for enriching hardWord entries
note: This dictionary provides detailed information for common difficult words found in the books

anarchist.definition: a person who believes in or tries to bring about anarchy; someone who rebels against any authority, established order, or ruling power
anarchist.exampleSentence: The anarchist refused to follow government rules.

cheque.definition: a written order to a bank to pay a stated sum from the drawer's account
cheque.exampleSentence: He wrote a cheque for one hundred dollars.

lord.definition: a man of noble rank or high office; a feudal superior; a master
lord.exampleSentence: The lord of the manor lived in a grand castle.

telepathy.definition: the supposed communication of thoughts or ideas by means other than the known senses
telepathy.exampleSentence: She seemed to know what I was thinking through telepathy.

shilling.definition: a former British coin worth one twentieth of a pound or twelve pence
shilling.exampleSentence: The book cost two shillings and sixpence.

toxicology.definition: the branch of science concerned with the nature, effects, and detection of poisons
toxicology.exampleSentence: The toxicology report showed traces of arsenic.

duchess.definition: the wife or widow of a duke; a woman holding a rank equivalent to duke in her own right
duchess.exampleSentence: The duchess attended the royal ball.

headless.definition: without a head; lacking a leader or direction
headless.exampleSentence: The headless horseman rode through the night.

painless.definition: not causing or involving pain; easy and simple
painless.exampleSentence: The dentist promised a painless procedure.

aquarium.definition: a transparent tank of water in which fish and other water creatures and plants are kept
aquarium.exampleSentence: We visited the aquarium to see tropical fish.

ballroom.definition: a large room for formal dancing
ballroom.exampleSentence: The couple danced in the grand ballroom.

jealous.definition: feeling or showing envy of someone or their achievements and advantages
jealous.exampleSentence: She was jealous of her sister's success.

fiancée.definition: a woman engaged to be married
fiancée.exampleSentence: He introduced his fiancée to his family.

doppelganger.definition: an apparition or double of a living person; a look-alike
doppelganger.exampleSentence: I saw my doppelganger walking down the street.

a.m..definition: ante meridiem - before noon (used to specify time between midnight and noon)

p.m..definition: post meridiem - after noon (used to specify time between noon and midnight)

o'clock.definition: used to specify the exact hour

queen.definition: a female monarch; the wife of a king
queen.exampleSentence: The queen ruled the kingdom wisely.

detective.definition: a person, especially a police officer, whose occupation is to investigate crimes

casualties.definition: people killed or injured in a war or accident
casualties.exampleSentence: The war resulted in many casualties.

newlyweds.exampleSentence: The newlyweds went on their honeymoon.

grief-stricken.exampleSentence: The grief-stricken family mourned their loss.

moustache.definition: hair growing on the upper lip
moustache.exampleSentence: He stroked his long moustache thoughtfully.

goulash.definition: a highly seasoned Hungarian stew of meat and vegetables
goulash.exampleSentence: She served traditional beef goulash for dinner.

receptionist.definition: a person employed to receive and assist visitors
receptionist.exampleSentence: The receptionist greeted guests at the hotel.

barman.definition: a person who serves drinks at a bar
barman.exampleSentence: The barman mixed a perfect cocktail.

enquiry.definition: an act of asking for information; an official investigation
enquiry.exampleSentence: She made an enquiry about train times.

surrender.definition: to stop resisting and submit to another's authority
surrender.exampleSentence: The army had to surrender after the battle.

interfere.definition: to prevent something from being done properly; to become involved in a situation without being asked

mugged.definition: to attack and rob someone in a public place
mugged.exampleSentence: He was mugged on his way home.

crossbow.definition: a weapon consisting of a bow fixed crosswise on a wooden stock
crossbow.exampleSentence: The medieval soldier used a crossbow.

swan.definition: a large waterbird with a long neck
swan.exampleSentence: The white swan glided across the lake.

wizard.definition: a man who has magical powers; an expert or genius
wizard.exampleSentence: The wizard cast a powerful spell.

bouquet.definition: an attractively arranged bunch of flowers
bouquet.exampleSentence: He gave her a bouquet of roses.

carriage.definition: a wheeled vehicle for passengers, typically drawn by horses
carriage.exampleSentence: The royal carriage arrived at the palace.

owl.definition: a bird of prey with large eyes and a hooked beak, active at night
owl.exampleSentence: An owl hooted in the darkness.

castle.definition: a large fortified building or group of buildings
castle.exampleSentence: The ancient castle stood on a hill.

superwoman.definition: a woman with exceptional strength or ability
superwoman.exampleSentence: She's a superwoman - she manages work and family perfectly.

houseboat.definition: a boat that is or can be used as a dwelling
houseboat.exampleSentence: They lived on a houseboat on the river.

scotch.exampleSentence: He ordered a glass of scotch on the rocks.

overcoat.definition: a long warm coat worn over other clothing
overcoat.exampleSentence: He put on his overcoat before going out in the cold.

august.definition: respected and impressive; or the eighth month of the year
august.exampleSentence: The august leader commanded great respect.

sunshine.definition: direct sunlight; a source of warmth and happiness

cinema.definition: a theater where movies are shown
cinema.exampleSentence: We went to the cinema to watch a film.
